panel.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a group of people with skills or specialist knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject
panel.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.
panel.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a group of well-known people who answer questions on a radio or television programme
panel.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: We have two senior politicians on our panel tonight.
panel.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a group of people who are chosen to listen to a case in a court of law and to decide the result
panel.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The panel spent 14 hours going over the evidence.
panel.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a flat piece of wood, glass etc with straight sides, which forms part of a door, wall, fence etc
panel.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: There were a few panels missing from the fence.
panel.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a piece of metal that forms part of the outer structure of a vehicle
panel.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: One of the door panels was badly damaged and had to be replaced.
panel.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a piece of material that forms part of a piece of clothing
panel.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: a skirt made in six panels
panel.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: a thin board with a picture painted on it
panel.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a group of people chosen to give advice or decide something
panel.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: An advisory panel will review new data on the safety of the products.
panel.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: in market research, a group of people chosen to discuss particular products so that changes can be made to them or to the way they are sold
panel.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: These findings are backed up by the panel research I mentioned earlier.
